definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to dig out/to excavate/to scoop out
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
to cut one's flesh to cover a sore (idiom); faced with a current crisis, to make it worse by a temporary expedient
see 吃水不忘掘井人[chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 jue2 jing3 ren2]
pinyin: chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 wa1 jing3 ren2

sentences.english: The boy scooped out a hole in the sand .
sentences.chinese: 那個男孩在沙中挖了個洞。

sentences.english: “Found down in the Dirksen excavation, ” he says.
sentences.chinese: “德克森中心挖地基的時候發現的，”他說。

sentences.english: That pile of earth came from the hole we dug in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 那堆土是我們在地上挖這個坑時掏出來的。

sentences.english: Using a slotted spoon, transfer apricots, hollow sides up, to a platter.
sentences.chinese: 用細勺將杏肉移至大淺盤中，挖去核的一側向上。

sentences.english: I need one, and your sons-in-law can dig new clay for Susana.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一把鍬，你的女婿可以幫蘇姍娜挖新的黏土。

sentences.english: The people dug and dug all around, then they found a few pieces of rusty iron.
sentences.chinese: 人們繼續在周圍挖，他們找到了幾片鏽鐵。

sentences.english: Some soldiers were told off to dig ditches.
sentences.chinese: 一些士兵被派去挖壕溝。

sentences.english: When digging a hole for planting, one should put topsoil and subsoil in two different sides of the hole.
sentences.chinese: 挖栽植坑時，應將表土和底土分別放在坑的兩側。

sentences.english: Digging endless, take endless, earn several hundred thousand a year.
sentences.chinese: 挖不盡，取不完，一年能賺十幾萬。

sentences.english: This small creature dishes out a shelter for itself in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 這個小動物會在地上挖凹形藏身洞。

sentences.english: Lastly, there's great potential here for crowdsourcing.
sentences.chinese: 最後，這裏還有很多潛力可挖。

sentences.english: Only by sticking to the socialist road can we do away with the root cause of poverty. (p. 330)
sentences.chinese: 只有堅定走社會主義門路才華挖失落窮根。

sentences.english: That old mine was worked out long ago.
I dug a hole in the yard to plant the maple tree.
sentences.chinese: 我在院子裏挖了一個洞來種楓樹。

sentences.english: You dig up the past, all you get is dirty.
sentences.chinese: 你把過去一股腦兒都挖了出來，那可都是見不得人的。

sentences.english: Picking your nose is a repulsive habit.
sentences.chinese: 挖鼻孔這種習慣很討厭。

definition: carpenter's plane/to plane (woodwork)/to shave off/to peel (with a potato peeler etc)
to dig/to excavate/(coll.) to exclude/not to count/to deduct/to subtract
to pry open or apart/to spread (sth) open with both hands
to lift/to pry open/to lever open
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl
